summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD F-250. WHILE THE CONTACT WAS FUELING THE VEHICLE, THE FUEL CAP SHRANK AND FUEL SPEWED FROM THE FUEL TANK. THE FAILURE OCCURRED WHENEVER HE ATTEMPTED TO FUEL THE FRONT TANK FIRST. AS THE FUEL TRAVELED TO THE REAR TANK, IT SPEWED OUT. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE FAILURE WAS A FIRE HAZARD. THE CONTACT DROVE THE VEHICLE TO FUTURE FORD OF ROSEVILLE (650 AUTOMALL DR, ROSEVILLE, CA 95661, (888) 656-7577), BUT THE MECHANICS REFUSED TO SERVICE THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 250,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD F-250. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 55 MPH, HE NOTICED THAT THE SPEEDOMETER AND CRUISE CONTROL FAILED TO OPERATE. IN ADDITION, THE ABS WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL. THE WARNING LIGHT REMAINED ILLUMINATED UNTIL THE ENGINE WAS TURNED OFF. THERE WAS A RECALL UNDER NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 8V051000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL:CRUISE CONTROL) HOWEVER THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED. THE CONTACT EXPERIENCED THE SIMILAR DEFECT AS MENTIONED IN THE RECALL. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED AT THE CONTACT'S EXPENSE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE PROBLEM. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 145,000.   UPDATED 10/17/12*LJ  THE CONSUMER VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE RECALL. UPDATED 10/18/12

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD F-250 EQUIPPED WITH COOPER DEAN MUD TERRAIN RADIAL SXT TIRES, SIZE 285/75/16.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE WERE BLISTERS BETWEEN THE LUGS. THE FRONT PASSENGER TIRE HAD WIRES PROTRUDING, WHICH WAS CAUSING TREAD SEPARATION.  THE MANUFACTURER ADVISED THE CONTACT THAT THE TIRES WERE NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA RECALL NUMBER: 06T003000(TIRES:TREAD/BELT).  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 234,242.

THIS IS  ABOUT A FUEL TANK DELIVERY AND AIR INDUCTION BULLETIN, CROSS TANK FUEL FLOW PROBLEM MY FORD F250 TRUCK IS HAVING. I HAVE NOTIFIED MY LOCAL DEALERSHIP AND FORD  CUSTOMER SERVICE, THEY BOTH SAY THERE IS NO RECALL FOR THIS VEHICLE.  BUT I FOUND A NHTSA CAMPAIGN # 93V12500 DESCRIBING EXACTLY WHAT HAS BEEN HAPPENING FOR THE LAST 6 MONTHS.  IT NEEDS TO BE FIXED AND IS EXPENSIVE, BUT I CAN'T GET ANY SATISFACTION FROM FORD, I'M HOPING YOU CAN HELP. *TR  UPDATED 04/15/10.*JB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS 1993 FORD F-250. WHILE DRIVING 60 MPH THE VEHICLE STARTED TO 'SHIMMY" VIOLENTLY. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION.  AFTER 4 DAYS THE TECHNICIAN CONCLUDED THAT THE TIRE PRESSURE WAS HIGH; HOWEVER, HE SPECULATED THAT THE TIRES WERE NOT THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE. THERE ARE NUMEROUS COMPLAINTS REGARDING THE "SHIMMY" ON SEVERAK YEAR, MAKE, AND MODELS, OF THE  F-SERIES. THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 61,000.

TIRE WENT FLAT FOR NO REASON ONLY HAD  2000 MILES ON THEM NOW THEY SAY THEY DON'T MAKE THEM ANYMORE SO I CANT GET ONE TO MATCH CAN NOT DRIVE  FORD F 250 TILL I FIND ONE. TIRE WAS A DAYTON A BAJA A/T WIDETRACK 33/1250/16.5 *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD F250.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR THE RECALL REPAIR REGARDING THE VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL: CRUISE CONTROL.  THE DEALER DISCONNECTED THE CRUISE CONTROL ON OCTOBER 17, 2007 AND INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT THE REPLACEMENT PART WAS NOT YET AVAILABLE.  THERE HAD BEEN NO FAILURE TO DATE.  THE RECALL NUMBER AND PURCHASE DATE WERE UNKNOWN.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 180,000.

FORD MOTOR COMPANY IS BEING NON-RESPONSIVE TO A RECALL NOTICE (08S01) THAT THEY HAVE SENT OUT. THEIR REPRESENTATIVE DEALERS ARE NOT BEING SUPPLIED PARTS TO MAKE THE REPAIR AND FORD MOTOR COMPANY REFUSES TO SAY WHEN THE PART WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD F250.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED A SAFETY RECALL NOTICE IN AUGUST OF 2007 FOR THE VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL.  THE CRUISE CONTROL WAS DISCONNECTED AT THAT TIME.  HE CALLED THEM AGAIN IN MARCH OF 2008 AND WAS INFORMED THAT THE PART WAS STILL UNAVAILABLE.  HE WAS RECENTLY INFORMED THAT THE PART WOULD BE AVAILABLE IN JUNE OF 2008.  THERE HAD BEEN NO FAILURE TO DATE.   THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 77,000.     UPDATE 04-02-08 *BF

NHTSA RECALL CAMPAIGN  01I008000 CONCERNING  FUEL CROSS FLOW.  AFTER HAVING  RECALL REPAIRS  PERFORMED THE PROBLEM RECURRED. VEHICLE WAS TAKEN BACK TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION, BUT MECHANIC COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM.  *AK

VEHICLE EXPERIENCED THE SAME DEFECT RELATED TO THE FUEL TANK OVERFLOWING AS STATED IN RECALL 010I 008 000.  THE CONSUMERS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN RECALL DUE TO VIN. THE CONSUMER HAD THE VEHICLE REPAIRED AT HIS EXPENSE.   *AK  *CB  *NLM
CONSUMER STATES THE FRONT BRAKE PADS, FRONT CALIPERS, REAR DRUMS AND ROTORS HAVE BEEN REPLACED AND RESURFACED.*JB

THE VEHICLE'S GAS TANK HAD A HOLE IN THE FLOAT AND THE GAUAGE CEASED TO WORK, THE CONSUMER HAD IT FIXED AND SOLD THE VEHICLE, THE COMPONENT WAS ON RECALL BUT THE CONSUMERS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED DUE TO VIN, THE CONSUMER IS REQUESTING REIMBURSEMENT. *YH

MY TRUCK PERIODICLY WOULD SHAKE UNCONTROLLABLY AFTER 35MPH CAUSING ME TO HAVE TO GET OUT OF TRAFFIC FAST TO AVOID AN ACCIDENT. SINCE THERE WAS NOTHING 'BROKEN' ON MY TRUCK, FORD HAD TO ADD A STABILIZER KIT TO THE FRONT END SUSPENSION. THEY INFORMED ME THAT THIS WAS NOT A RECALL ITEM. AS IT COULD HAVE CAUSED AN ACCIDENT I AM REPORTING THIS POORLY ENGINEERED FRONT END SUSPENSION PROBLEM.*AK

REPORTED THIS TO GAS STATION WHERE HE WAS FILLING HIS TANK AT THE TIME.  *AK  RECALL 93V125, HOWEVER CONSUMER'S VEHICLE IS NOT INCLUDED, CONSUMER WAS INJURED BY THE GASOLINE BURNS.   *SLC

CONSUMER IS HAVING PROBLEMS WITH  FUEL TANK  WHIC IS SIMILAR TO PROBLEMS MENTIONED IN  RECALL 00V42400O. *AK   ONE OF THE TANK HAD BEEN REPLACED.  THE CONSUMER FEELS THE MANUFACTURER SHOULD BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL THE REPAIRS.  *YH
EXISTING RECALL- FUEL DUMPED INTO REAR TANK CAUSING FUEL SPILL ALSO CREATING EXCESSIVE PRESSURE IN REAR TANK.  *AK

DUAL FUEL TANKS.   FUEL IS RUNNING FROM FRONT TANK TO REAR WHICH IS CAUSING IT TO OVERFLOW AND LEAK ONTO STREET, RESULTING IN  FIRE HAZARD. DEALER REPLACED PUMP ASSEMBLY, AND OTHER RELATED PARTS, BUT DEFECT STILL OCCURS. *AK

THERE IS A GAS LEAK WITHIN VEHICLE. AN OPEN INVESTIGATION FOR THIS PROBLEM, BUT CONSUMER'S  RECALL WAS NOT PART OF IT. CONSUMER   HAD  SAME PROBLEM AS RECALL 93V125OO, FUEL TANK  ASSEMBLY.  *AK

IN THE WAY OF AN INTRODUCTION, AND TO HELP EXPLAIN THE TECHNICAL DETAIL IN THE FOLLOWING DESCRIPTION, I THINK IT IS WORTHWHILE TO EXPLAIN THAT I AM A RETIRED RESEARCH AND TEST ENGINEER WHO SPENT 22 YEARS OF MY PROFESSIONAL CAREER AS AN ENGINEER WORKING FOR PACCAR INC, THEY MANUFACTURE KENWORTH AND PETERBILT TRUCKS.  THE VAST MAJORITY OF MY TIME WITH PACCAR WAS SPENT TESTING AUTOMOTIVE PRODUCTS AT THEIR TRUCK R&D CENTER.  ( DOT NUMBER: PJOR D6KV TIRE SIZE: LT235/85R1 )

FIRST REPORTED DEFECT, CRUISE CONTROL. WHILE DRIVING ON 2 LANE AT CRUISE SPEED OF 40 MPH, ENTERED REDUCED SPEED ZONE, TAPPED BRAKES TO RELEASE CRUISE CONTROL AND SLOW TO 30 MPH, RELEASED BRAKE WHEN DESIRED SPEED WAS REACHED, VEHICLE SUDDENLY ACCELERATED, 2000 RPM ON TACH., RELEASED CRUISE WITH SWITCH ON STEERING WHEEL, FORD CUSTOMER SERVICE CONTACTED IN DETROIT, MI, STATED NO KNOWN RECALL, MY PROBLEM.   SECOND ITEM NOTED, SINCE VEHICLE WAS PURCHASED, NEW, FRONT STEERING ASSEMBLY GREESE/DUST BOOTS HAVE SPLIT, DEALER REPLACED TWICE, ASKED TO DELAY THIRD REPLACEMENT UNTIL FORD COULD WORK OUT PROBLEM, WHEN RETURNED TO DEALER, UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP, TOLD TRUCK OUT OF WARRANTEE, PROBLEM WAS MINE, EVEN THOUGHT FORD FAILED TO EVER REPAIR.  *AK

EA93020; FRONT TANK  WAS FILLING UP  REAR TANK WHICH COULD HAVE CAUSED FUEL TO SPILL OVER. BUT, CONSUMER WAS ABLE TO SWITCH OVER TO THE FRONT TANK BEFORE IT SPILLED.  FORD  CLAIMED FUEL PUMP IN THE REAR TANK WILL NEED TO BE REPLACED.*AK
NO SUMMARY

FRONT TIRE BLEW OUT (TREAD SEPARATED) AT 70 MPH, LOST CONTROL, DID NOT WRECK, MINOR DAMAGE TO VEHICLE FENDER. I HAVE PICTURES OF THE TIRE IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO HAVE THEM. I HAVE REMOVED THE MATE TO THIS TIRE BECAUSE THE SCARE I HAD.  *AK (DOT NUMBER: VDOR65B187  TIRESIZE: 23585R16 M)

CONSUMER HAD 2 REBUILD TRANSMISSIONS PUT IN A YEAR.   ONCE  VEHICLE  WENT INTO OVERDRIVE AND  IF THE LIGHT CAME ON, CONSUMER HAD TO GET TO A DELAER IMMEDIATELY OR TRANSMISSION WOULD BE RUINED.   WHEN VEHICLE WAS PUT ON THE DIAGNOSTIC MACHINE, THEY COULDN'T  FIND  ANYTHING. BUT, WHEN TEST DRIVEN THEY KNEW THAT THERE WAS A PROBLEM.  *AK

I CONSIDERED IT TO BE HIGHLY UNUSAL THAT MY STEERING SHOULD FAIL LIKE THIS. MY STEERING COLUMN BEARINGS FAILED. I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW IF THIS HAS OCCURRED IN OTHER VEHICLES OR IF THERE HAS BEEN ANY FATALITES. I WOULD LIKE TO BE REIMBURSED BY FORD MOTER COMPANY.  *AK

summary: WHILE STARTING  UP TRUCK DRIVE BELT FELL OFF. ALSO,  THERE WERE NO BRAKES OR STEERING WHEN THIS HAPPENED. CONSUMER HAD TO REPLACE DRIVE BELT SIX TIMES. CONSUMER INDICATED  IF GOING DOWN A HILL VEHICLE  WOULD HAVE CRASHED.  NEITHER DEALER NOT MANUFACTURER PROVIDED ANY HELP.  *AK *ML

CONSUMER WAS INVOLVED IN A FRONTAL COLLISION IN WHICH THE DRIVER SHOULDER BELT DID NOT LOCK UP, CAUSING DRIVER TO RECEIVE MASSIVE HEAD INJURIES.   *AK  COLLISION WAS FRONTAL WITH DRIVER'S SIDE DAMAGE.  THE DRIVER'S SHOULDER PORTION OF RESTRAINT RESULTING INFATALITY FAILED.  *YH
4- WHEEL DRIVE  LOCKING  HUBS FAILED,  CAUSING  POWER TRAIN AXLE ASSEMBLY TO LOCK UP. VEHICLE IN DEALER SHOP. *AK

WHILE DRIVING  STARTED SMELLING EXHAUST FUMES INSIDE VEHICLE. DRIVER STARTED GETTING A HEADACHE. TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER & MECHANIC NOTICE BOLTS ON MOTOR SHEARED OFF ATTACHMENT. PROBLEM REPAIRABLE, BUT WILL REAPPEAR DUE TO DESIGN OF BOLTS. MANUFACTURER KNOWS OF PROBLEM. *AK
CONSUMERS TANK WAS LEAKING PER RECALL 93V125 BUT WAS NOT REPAIRED UNDER RECALL DUE TO VIN.  NLM
THE VEHICLE HAS HAD CONTINUED PROBLEMS WITH ENGINE KNOCKING, THE DEALERSHIP WILL TEMPORARILY FIX THE PROBLEM BUT THEN IT RETURNS.  *MJS

THE INCIDENT WITH THE SERPENTINE BELT TENSIONER,AGAIN RESULTED IN LOSS OF STEERING, AND BRAKING EFFECTIVENESS DUE TO THE VACUUM PUMP BEING RUN BY THE ACCESSORY DRIVE BELT. THE VEHICLE WAS DIFFICULT TO STOP, AND STEERING WAS EXTREMELY HARD. IF MY WIFE WERE DRIVING THE VEHICLE, THERE WOULD SURELY HAVE BEEN AN ACCIDENT, ESPECIALLY AT HIGHER HIGHWAY SPEEDS. THIS IS THE THIRD TIME THAT THIS UNIT HAS BEEN REPLACED ON THIS ENGINE. FORD HAS NOT COME UP WITH A SUITABLE ENGINEERING DESIGN TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FAILURE. I EXPECT THAT THIS WILL AGAIN FAIL SOMETIME IN THE FUTURE, I HOPE NOT WITH DISASTEROUS RESULTS. THE DAMPENER, SHOCK ABSORBER FAILED CAUSING PREMATURE WEAR, AND SUBSEQUENT FAILURE OF THE TENSIONER. THE RECALL WHICH WAS DONE ON THIS VEHICLE WAS NOT AS EFFECTIVE AS YOU WERE LED TO BELIEVE. THE DEFROSTER ALSO FAILS TO GO INTO THE DEFROST MODE ONCE THE VEHICLE IS EXTREMELY COLD, AND THE BLOWER MOTOR IS MAKING A GRINDING, SQUEELING NOISE. I EXPECT THAT THESE WILL STOP COMPLETLY IN THE NEAR FUTURE.
POROUS BLOCK DUMPED WATER INTO CYLINDARS

NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK

WITH BOTH TANKS FULL OF FUEL & THE REAR TANK IS SWITCHED ON,THE GASOLINE IS PUMPED BACK INTO THE FRONT TANK.SINCE THE REAR TANK HOLDS 16 GALLONS OF GASOLINE IT IS PUMPED TO THE FRONT TANK,OVERFLOWING OUT THE FILL NOZZLE ONTO THE GROUND.

VEHICLE WAS PARKED. WITHIN 10 MINUTES THE VEHICLE WAS BURNING, THE REPORT INDICATED THAT UNSPECIFIED SHORT (ELECTRICAL) STARTED THE FIRE THAT TOTALLED THE VEHICLE,  POSSIBLY THE ENIGTION SWITCH SHORTED OUT.  *AK
POSSIBLE IGNITION SWITCH FAILURE RESULTED IN VEHICLE FIRE. MJS
KEY SWITCH FAILED, REPLACEMENT IS FAILING, KEY COMES OUT OF IGNITION WHEN AT ANY POSITION. MJS
NO SUMMARY

BACK TANK STARTED LEAKING LAST SUMMER. REAR TANK STARTED IN JANUARY THIS YEAR. GASOLINE IN GARAGE CAUSED HAZARD. VEJHICLE WASHED REGULARLY. BOTH TANKS RUSTED AT SEAMS, POSSIBLY ON LEFT SIDE OF SADDLE. REPLACED TANKS AT MY COST BUT ADVISED WHERE IT WAS DON

SERVICE BULLETIN 95-5-24 WAS SENT TO ME 9 TO 12 MONTHS AGO ON A COOLING SYSTEM ADDITIVE TO ADD TO MY SYSTEM TO PREVENT CORROSION OF THE BLOCK AND EATING THROUGH THE CYLINDER WALLS. I ADDED THE REQUIRED AMOUNT OF THIS ADDITIVE, AND HAVE NOT GIVEN IT MUCH THOUGHT UNTIL MY ENGINE SEIZED UP. WHEN THE ENGINE WAS TORN DOWN IT WAS FOUND TO BE CAUSED BY PIN HOLES THROUGH THE CYLINDER WALLS WHICH LET COOLANT WASH DOWN THE CYLINDER WALLS AND CAUSED THE ENGINE TO SEIZE AND BEND A ROD. CURRENTLY THE ENGINE IS APART UNTIL I CAN FIGURE OUT WHAT TO DO. FORD TOLD ME THAT EVENTHOUGH THEY DESIGNED A FAULTY SYSTEM, THAT THEY DO NOT HAVE TO DO ANYTHING, AND THAT IS WHY I AM SENDING THIS TO YOU.   ALSO THE BULLETIN CAME OUT IN 95 AND I NEVER RECEIVED A COPY UNTIL LATE 97. I WISH I STILL HAD A COPY OF THE BULLETIN. HOPE YOU CAN HELP!
IDLER PULLEY/TENSIONER AND SERPENTINE BELT FAILED SEVERAL TIMES AFTER RECALL REPAIR WORK CAUSING LOSS OF BRAKING CONTROL.
THE ENGINE ELECTROLYSIS BETWEEN WATER & DIESEL, MADE HOLES IN CYLINDER WALLS FROM INSIDE OUT. IT HAD RUINED THE ENGINE.  *AK
FUEL PUMPS FOR BOTH TANKS ON THE DUEL SYSTEM FAILED CAUSING LEAKING OF GAS.
VIBRATION WHILE BRAKING DUE TO FAILURE OF THE BRAKE DRUMS AND ROTORS.
BRAKE BOOSTER LOCKED UP CAUSING ROTORS AND DRUMS TO HEAT UP AND CAUSE DAMAGE TO COMPONENTS.
ABS MODULE FAILED RESULTING IN VIBRATION.
FUEL PUMP EMPTIES THE FUEL INTO THE OTHER TANK IMMEDIATELY. *AK

BRAKE CALIPERS STARTED TO FAIL AT 30,000 MILES.  DID NOT GET FIXED UNTIL 40,000 MILES WHEN PROBLEM PROHIBITED THE SAFE OPERATION OF THE VEHICLE.  THEN AT 52,000 THE ENTIRE BRAKE CALIPER SYSTEM FAILED AGAIN, WHICH IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE.  LUCKILY, I WAS ABLE TO CONTROL THE VEHILE WHEN THIS LAST INCIDENT OCCURED, THEREBY, AVOIDING AN ACCIDENT.
CONSUMER FILLED BOTH TANKS ON VEHICLE.  UPON DRIVING VEHICLE BEGAN TO SPILL FUEL. RECALL 93V125000.  *AK

THE  CLUTCH LINKAGE COMES OFF THE CLUTCH ARM , CAUSING THE VEHICLE NOT BE ABLE TO SHIFT GEARS OR BRAKE, WHICH MAY CAUSE AN ACCIDENT.  *AK
